commits.author: Camilo Valdes
commits.summary: Use swift command directly in Run command
commits.body: The use the `xcrun` shim is no longer required with the current release of Xcode, the macosx SDK is also now included by default.

commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Update shabang snippet, remove env snippet
commits.body: `swift` can now be called directly now allowing simplification of this snippet, and allows deleting of the special `env` snippet in favor of the one from the Shell Script bundle.

commits.author: Jacob Bandes-Storch
commits.summary: Re-enable pairing parentheses for string interpolation \(…)

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: An enumeration case with a payload was messing up the indent
commits.body:
This is because our decrease indent pattern was looking for a case with a colon on the same line, but an enumeration case with a payload will also have a colon, so we now require the colon to be at the end of the line (sans whitespace and trailing comments).

Example of enumeration with payload:

	enum Error: ErrorType {
		case POSIXError(action: String, errorNumber: CInt, systemExit: CInt)
		case InternalError(reason: String, systemExit: CInt)
		case UsageError
	}

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: For documentation with Swift results we ignore other languages
commits.body: A downside is that the fragment identifier seems to work better for non-Swift matches, for example looking up GCD constants (defines) will go to the top of the GCD documentation, but for C it will jump to the constant that we looked up.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body: This defaults to '^(?!.*?iOS\.docset)' which means that iOS documentation is ignored by default.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body:
This command uses `docsetutil` to lookup the current word/selection.

It does not filter out C or Objective-C results since some things are only available in these docs. It also does not filter on iOS/OS X since we don’t know which of the SDKs the user prefer.

The command borrows heavily from the documentation lookup command in the Objective-C bundle, it would make sense to merge them, but the version in the Objective-C bundle also looks for selectors and manual pages so it is a tad more complex.

commits.author: Jacob Bandes-Storch
commits.summary: Consider external parameter names to be part of the function name
